title: Centre-right Stubb wins Finnish presidential election
description: Centre-right Alexander Stubb has declared victory over liberal Green Party member Pekka Haavisto in Finland's presidential election.

description: Stubb, who becomes commander-in-chief and will lead his country’s foreign policy, has vowed a hard line against Russia.

title: Wellingborough: Calls for action on gangs at by-election debate
description: Calls for more visible policing and new initiatives to draw young people away from gangs have been heard in a BBC East Wellingborough by-election discussion. The town, facing a by-election on Thursday, is still haunted by the death of teenager Dylan Holliday, who was stabbed 13 times.

title: Fury as Sir Keir Starmer stands by candidate who blames Israel for October 7 massacre
description: SIR Keir Starmer has sparked fury by standing by a candidate who blamed Israel for the October 7 massacre. Labour’s leader was rapped for appeasing anti-Semitism. Sir Keir refused to withdraw

title: Labour Rochdale by-election candidate apologises for ‘deeply offensive’ Israel claims
description: A Labour by-election candidate has apologised for his “deeply offensive” comments, after he reportedly said Israel allowed Hamas to carry out its October 7 attack to provide grounds to invade Gaza.

title: Labour candidate 'wrong' to say Israel allowed 7 October attack
description: Remarks made by Azhar Ali have been branded "warped" and "disgraceful" by the Jewish community, which fears they could further fuel hostility, but with the deadline for nominations closed it is too late for the party to replace him.

title: Finns choose centre-right Stubb as president, preliminary results show

title: Now eco-zealots target Monet masterpiece in environmental protest, splashing soup over Le Printemps just weeks after copycat art attack on Da Vinci's Mona Lisa in The Louvre
description: The Musee des Beaux-Arts in Lyon, France 's third largest city, said in a statement that the attack on Claude Monet's 'Le Printemps' (Spring) took place at 3.30pm local time on Saturday.

title: Centre-right Stubb leads Finland's presidential vote in early results
description: HELSINKI (Reuters) -Alexander Stubb of the centre-right National Coalition Party led in the run-off vote for Finland's next president on Sunday, with 52.7% support in early results, justice ministry data showed. The liberal Green Party member Pekka ...

title: Stubb leads Finland's presidential election with 52.7% in early results
description: Centre-right Alexander Stubb of the National Coalition Party led in the run-off of Finland's presidential election on Sunday, with 52.7% support from ballots cast in advance, justice ministry data showed.

title: Starmer and Reeves should listen to Brown’s call for action on child poverty

description: It showcases ingenuity and a pleasing can-do attitude that doesn’t mess about if you want to access power very quickly.

title: Labour donor urges party to borrow billions for green revolution
description: Millionaire Labour donor Dale Vince is urging Sir Keir Starmer to borrow billions of pounds to boost net zero and rid fossil fuels from Britain’s energy infrastructure.

title: Scientists issue terrifying Atlantic Ocean warning that could cause European deep freeze

title: Former PM Alexander Stubb wins Finnish presidency, narrowly defeating ex-top diplomat Pekka Haavisto
description: Former Prime Minister Alexander Stubb won Finland’s election runoff Sunday against ex-Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto in a close race for the presidency and the task of steering the Nordic country’s foreign and security policy now that it is a member of NATO,

title: Democrats Insist They Won’t Forget DREAMers As They Shift Right On Immigration
description: Senate Democrats insisted that they weren’t leaving Dreamers or other undocumented immigrants behind, and that, if anything, this year’s negotiations would allow them to build on their progress since they can now point to the GOP’s refusal to accept the deal as evidence of their hypocrisy on the issue.

title: Gove says PM was ‘absolutely right’ to use trans jibe to criticise Starmer
description: Michael Gove has defended Rishi Sunak over a transgender joke he made at PMQs this week, saying the Prime Minister was “absolutely right” to use it to criticise Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer for his past U-turns.

title: Labour candidate Azhar Ali apologises for Israel comments
description: Labour's candidate in the Rochdale by-election has apologised for remarks he made about Israel in a local party meeting. In a secret recording obtained by the Mail on Sunday, Azhar Ali reportedly said Israel had "allowed" the deadly attack by Hamas gunmen on 7 October.

title: The Gloucestershire stories you may have missed in the past seven days
description: A potentially hazardous material has led to the indefinite closure of a library in Gloucestershire. Stroud Library was closed with immediate effect on Monday, February 5, following the discovery of RAAC (Reinforced Autoclaved Aerated Concrete) in the building.
